snippet: As millions of residents worry about produce from mainland China, more are tending tiny plots on rooftops, on balconies and in far-flung corners of the city.
abstract: More Hong Kong residents are growing their own food as they grow increasingly worried about safety of fruits, vegetables, meats and processed foods coming from mainland China; concern is also driving demand for organic food.
lead_paragraph: As millions of residents worry about produce from mainland China, more are tending tiny plots on rooftops, on balconies and in far-flung corners of the city.

headline.seo: Fearing Tainted Imports, Hong Kong Squeezes In Farms
headline.main: In Organic-Hungry Hong Kong, Corn as High as an Elevator’s Climb
headline.print_headline: In Organic-Hungry Hong Kong, Corn as High as an Elevator’s Climb
